eventDescription: The first meeting of Samaj was held at the premises of Manji Arjan and Company where Mr. Karsanbhai Devraj Vekaria of gaam Baladia was appointed as the First Chairman. The main objective of this meeting was to build a community (Samaj) building in Mombasa, Kenya and raise funds for the same.
First meeting was convened to deliberate on the Rules and regulation of the Samaj.
The foundation stone laying ceremony of Mombasa Samaj conducted.
Opening ceremony for Mombasa Samaj.
Proposal to construct a building for Nairobi Samaj was put forward by Mr. Ramjibhai Kunverji of Gaam Baladia.
Approval for construction of Nairobi Samaj Building was given.
Approval for purchase of Land to construct Nairobi Samaj was given.
Purchase of Land on Ronald Ngala Street in Nairobi for construction of Nairobi Samaj at a value of Kenya Shillings 180,000.00.
Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj, Nairobi was officially registered as per the laws of Kenya.
On the auspicious day of Ramnavmi the Foundation Stone laying Ceremony for Nairobi Samaj Building was held with the donor being Mr. Nanjibhai Harji Varsani of Gaam Manukva.
Commencement of construction for the building of Nairobi Samaj.
Inauguration of the Nairobi Samaj building.

eventItems.item: The inauguration of the Main Entrance was carried out by Mr. Khimjibhai Ramji and Mr. Bhimjibhai Ramji of Gaam Baladia.
The inauguration of the Main Hall was carried out by Mr. Ramjibhai Kunverji of Gaam Baladia.
The Guest House was inaugurated by Mr. Lajibhai Harji in Memory of Nanjibhai Harji Varsani of Gaam Manukva.

eventDescription: Permission to place the portrait of Mr. Nanji Harji Varsani in the Main Hall.
First meeting to address and possibly mitigate matrimonial disputes.
Swayamsevak Dal was formed.
Library was inaugurated and opened.
Approval to start Nursery at Nairobi Samaj.
Approval to open the first Bank account for Nairobi Samaj with The Standard Bank of South Africa.
Proposal to abolish child Marriages in the community.
Proposal and deliberation on how to raise the Education level within the community.
Fund raising for the relief of devastation caused by the disastrous Earth Quack in Kutch.
Approval for acquisition of land parcel for construction of school.
First open social gathering of community members.
Inauguration of extension of the existing samaj building.
Discussion on establishment of Shree Kutch Leva Patel Samaj Boarding in Bhuj, Kutch.
Appointment of Patel, Shah and Joshi auditors as the first auditors of the Nairobi Samaj.
Large amount of cash and precious ornaments were collected as funds by the community members to support India against the invasion by China.
Approval for providing interest free loans to community members for higher education.
Event to honor students who have excelled in their higher education began.
The first constitution booklet of the Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj Nairobi was issued.
A special discussion was held by the Nairobi Samaj regarding the establishment of Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj in Bhuj – Kutch.
The constitution of SCLP Samaj - Bhuj was approved.
Election by voting in Nairobi Samaj was held for the first time for the post of Vice-Chairman.
The 15th anniversary of the Establishment of the Nairobi - Samaj was celebrated, and a souvenir released.
Additional funds raised for Mombasa Samaj.
Fundraising by bidding was held at Nairobi Samaj for inauguration ceremony of the Bhuj Samaj.

eventItems.item: Inauguration of Main Building by Mr. Mavjibhai Ruda Varsani
Inauguration of the upper floor by Mr. Devshibhai Dhanji Vekaria
Inauguration of the meeting room by Mr. Veljibhai Karsan
Foundation stone laying of Kanya High School by Mr. Harjibhai Ladha

eventDescription: Approval was given to place the portrait of Mr. Devshibhai Dhanji Vekaria in the Samaj Main Hall.
Mahila Mandal – Nairobi Formed.
The first Diwali get together was held at Nairobi Samaj.
The 25th anniversary of the Establishment of the Samaj – Nairobi was celebrated, and a souvenir released.

On the visit to Kenya by The Prime Minister of India, Mrs. Indira Gandhi, she remembered the service of our civilian community ladies during the war with Pakistan was applauded during a courtesy visit to her by a delegation of Nairobi Samaj Leaders and Elders.
The Shree Cuchi Leva Patel Samaj "World Conference" was held at Bhuj Samaj.
Funds were collected to help the affected community members during political tension in Kenya.
Funds were raised for the Girls Hostel of Pangani Girls Secondary School.
Approval for the purchase of 6.75 acres of land in Nairobi West for New Samaj development.
Approval for the construction of the Samaj - Nairobi West Complex.

eventItems.item: The foundation stone laying ceremony of Nairobi West Samaj Complex was done by Mr. Ratnabhai Karsan Raghwani's family.
The foundation stone laying ceremony of the Samaj School was done by Mr. Ramjibhai Govind Halai & Sons.
Foundation stone laying ceremony of the Samaj Staff Quarters was done by Mr. Devshibhai Kunvarji Garara's family.
The Samaj Hall was to be named 'Shri Devshibhai Dhanji Memorial Hall.
The kitchen hall was to be named after Mr. Kunvarji Devraj Varsani & Sons.
The health center was to be named after Mr. Gopal Shivji Jadwa Hirani family.

eventDescription: An additional seven and a half acres of land adjacent to the Samaj land was acquired.
Samaj Youth League was formed.
Religious Havan ceremony for New Nairobi West Samaj was held.
A decision was made regarding renting the old Samaj Building.
The New Nairobi West Samaj Complex was inaugurated.
The Board of Governors (B.O.G) was formed for the management of Samaj School.
Agreed to place the Murtis of The Gods on the stage of samaj hall.
Approval of rules and regulations of Samaj Medical Relief Scheme (M.R.S).
Inauguration of the Samaj School.
5 acres of land were acquired next to the Samaj Nairobi West Complex.
The Samaj in conjunction with Hindu Council of Kenya raised funds for drought relief in Kenya.
A decision was taken regarding the sale of the Old Samaj building on Ronald Ngala Street.
The first mass marriage was held at Nairobi Samaj.
The School at Nairobi West was Named Shree L. R. Pindolia Academy.
Sale of the Samaj Building on Ronald Ngala Street.
It was decided proceeds from the sale of the samaj building on Ronald Ngala Street would be used to build housing for the Community members.
The Medical Relief Scheme was started.
A tree planting program was held in the Samaj compound.
The Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Charitable Trust was formed, and trustees appointed.
Warren Enterprises Ltd. and H. Young (EA) donated a tower water tank.
A decision was made to transfer the medical and bursary funds to Samaj charitable trust.
Foundation stone laying of Samaj Flat Phase-I was held.

eventItems.item: Mr. Shantilal Velji Bhanderi for Block No. A
Mr. Laljibhai Ratna Raghwani for Block No. B
Laxmanbhai Construction Co. for Block No. C

eventDescription: The construction of the canteen and library was completed.
The work on the Samaj Cricket Ground was completed, and the Samaj Team was named the Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Samaj Cricket Team.
It was decided that the Shree Cutchi Leva Patel Charitable Trust will undertake the management of the Samaj School.
The average price of Phase I flats in Nairobi West was set at 1,025,000/- for a two-bedroom and 1,225,000/- for a three-bedroom.
The inauguration of Samaj Flats Phase I.
Foundation stone laying ceremony of Samaj Flats Phase-II was performed by respective donors.

eventItems.item: Mr. Kalyanbhai Naran Kerai for Block No-D in memory of his mother Late Lalbai Naran Kerai
Mr. Karshanbhai Lalji Vekaria and Mrs. Kesarben Karsan Vekaria for Block No-E
Mr. Ramjibhai Keshra Varsani for Block No-F

eventDescription: Inauguration of swimming pool, donated by the Laxmanbhai Group and the pool named 'Raghwani Pool'.
The construction of Samaj Flats Phase-II was completed.
The Foundation stone laying of Samaj Medical Clinic building.
Approval for the construction of the volleyball ground.
The foundation laying ceremony of the Samaj Nursery School was done by donors Mr. Karsanbhai Lalji Vekaria and Mrs. Kesarbai Karsan Vekaria.
Approved the Samaj Charitable Trust to send Kenya Shillings 1 crore for Kutch earthquake relief to Bhuj Samaj.
Approval was granted for placing 40 billboards for advertisement in the Samaj Cricket Ground.
The Samaj Clinic Building was inaugurated, in the name of Mr. Kurjibhai Vishram Vekaria.
The construction of Samaj Secondary School Building was completed and named R. R. Varsani Secondary Section.
The work of building gabions on banks on both sides of the river passing through the samaj compound was completed.
The Constitution of the School Board of governors and Samaj Charitable Trust was amended.
The Samaj celebrated its 50th anniversary and the 10th anniversary of the new complex in Nairobi West during Easter Holidays and a souvenir published.
The inauguration of Samaj Nursery School held during the Samaj Golden Jubilee celebration and the Nursery was named Smt. Amarbai Devshi Dhanji Nursery School.
